Job_Descriptions: 1. WEEKEND SUNDRIES is a local womenswear brand and retailer, focusing on timeless designs and the use of sustainable, natural fabrics. We are looking for a Fashion Sales Associate to take ownership of our brick-&-mortar shop at Great World by providing a memorable and excellent retail experience. The candidate must be keen on sales, customer service and passionate about fashion to showcase the brand's products and make recommendations that best fit the needs of our customers. Able to identify customer's needs and opportunities to achieve sales target. Perform daily sales activities, reporting, stock control and replenishment. Communicate well and clearly with team members Contribute to a positive and inclusive work environment Any other ad hoc operational duties assigned. Requirements: GCE N / O levels with a pass in English or equivalent min. 1 year sales experience Sales driven and results oriented Passionate about customer service Cheerful, energetic with a positive mindset and a responsible team player. Able to work on rotating shift, weekends and public holidays

Job Description Software Project Manager We are looking for an organized, detail-oriented individual to join our team as a software project manager. The responsibilities of the software project manager include overseeing software projects from start to finish, managing and motivating software developers and other team members, giving customer presentations, and writing project proposals. To be successful as a software project manager, you should have a good working knowledge of project estimation techniques and the ability to motivate team members. Ultimately, a top-notch software project manager should have good communication and decision-making skills. Software Project Manager Responsibilities: Discussing potential projects and their parameters with clients, executives, and software developers. Planning out the blueprints for software projects, including defining the scope, allocating resources, setting deadlines, laying out communication strategies, and indicating tests and maintenance. Assembling and leading the project team. Participating in and supervising each stage of the project. Ensuring each project stays on schedule and adheres to the deadlines. Creating a project budget and ensuring the project adheres to the budget as closely as possible. Determining and overseeing consistent testing, evaluation, and troubleshooting of all products in all stages of completion. Tracking milestones, deliverables, and change requests. Serving as a liaison to communicate information regarding changes, milestones reached, and other pertinent information. Delivering completed software products to clients and performing regular checks on the products' performance. Software Project Manager Requirements: A bachelor's degree in information technology, software development management, software engineering, computer science, or a related field. Proven experience in project management and software development. Good working knowledge of project estimation techniques. Excellent technical knowledge. Good leadership, decision-making, and organization skills. Strong attention to detail and multi-tasking skills. Job_Title: Senior Vice President - Private Bank/Wealth Management - AML Compliance Risk Management
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : The Compliance Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Risk Management Senior Officer is a senior level position responsible for establishing internal procedures to prevent money laundering and assist in all matters concerning financial crimes in coordination with the broader AML team. The overall objective is to utilize established disciplinary knowledge to identify inconsistencies in data or result and formulate strategic recommendations on policies, procedures, and practices. Wealth Management in APAC (incl CPB) is embarking on an ambitious expansion plan over the next 5 years and the candidate should hold the skill sets to navigate through this change project by supporting the business as well as adapt to the new expanded model in APAC. The primary objective of the Regional Citi Private Bank ACRM team is to pro-actively develop, monitor, and oversee realized and potential AML risks within the Wealth Management businesses, keep senior management apprised of the levels of new AML risk, and advise the business owners concerning methods and controls to manage that risk. Responsibilities: Execute and implement firm-wide AML risk management policy and strategic direction Maintain AML compliance program for the business including assessment of risks and the development of policies, procedures, and governance Identify and assess risk, vulnerabilities, and opportunities for efficient and effective risk coverage Work within team and across business/functional line management to assess complex issues, structure potential solutions, and drive effective resolution within permissible statutory and regulatory frameworks Analyze data, prepare and present regional/global reports related to AML risk assessments Monitor AML related issues and escalations with senior management and global partners Evaluate and respond to escalated matters, further escalate as required, and advise senior management on next steps as needed Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 10+ years of relevant experience Anti-Money Laundering (AML) certification Experience in managing regulatory exams and relationships with examiners and auditors Extensive knowledge of appropriate regulatory requirements including local and US laws, international and industry standards Extensive knowledge of AML regulations, risks, and appropriate controls Demonstrated analytical skills Demonstrated leadership and motivational skills Ability to work with regional and global partners, and influence and lead people across culture and senior level Education: Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience Master's degree preferred ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Compliance and Control ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: AML Compliance & Risk Mgmt ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job_Title: International Private Bank Operations- Fee Project Manager- Associate
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Operations Overview Operations are uniquely positioned at the heart of all that we do. We impact the business we undertake from end to end. Our department supports all key business and platform initiatives. We oversee the processes that make our business work. Our role is all about understanding the impact of change on our processes, and institutionalizing a change mindset that drives improvements in all areas. It's also about maintaining the efficient processes our people rely on every day to do first-class business, whilst constantly striving to achieve the improvement that makes the firm one of the most respected financial institutions in the world. Our team executes various Programs that design operating models, provide solutions to optimize business flows, bring efficiencies and keep our platform compliant with regulations applicable to our legal entities and branches. Our success depends on a close collaboration with counterparts from all areas including the Business, Technology, Finance and Corporate Functions and other Lines of Business. That mindset and collaboration is an integral part of what makes the firm one of the most respected financial institutions in the world. The Role Being part of the Projects & Business Innovation Support team, the successful candidate will be working in conjunction with our internal partners including Client Service, Advisors, Operations, Technology, Product, Business Management and Compliance. Our team executes various Programs that provide solutions to optimize business flows, bring efficiencies, enhance controls and keep our platform compliant with regulations applicable to our legal entities and branches. This is a unique opportunity to gain an in depth knowledge of all operational flows and contribute to a growing international business in a fast paced and innovative environment.In particular the role will require to work on one of the key programs for the Bank which is the implementation of the Strategic platform for Fees. Requirements Bachelor degree holder The candidate must have at least 4 years ofexperience in one or several of the operations area (back or middle office)in a reputable bank, fund administrator or financial institution and at least 2 years in project management. The candidate must have the ability to drive the strategic objective and communicate appropriately. In addition, he/she must demonstrate an exceptional capacity to exercise good judgment under pressure. Strong operations knowledge, especially experience in Fee Operations is highly desirable. Previous experience in Agile methodology and Product Owner model is a plus. Previousexperience in consulting would be a plus. Be responsible for the planning, management and execution of projects through a project plan and engagement of stakeholders. Determine the milestones and underlying requirements to execute the project plan in conjunction with stakeholders across the various functional groups (Legal, Compliance, Technology, Operations, Business Management, Risk), Manage and prioritize initiatives that are requested by stakeholders, Plan and coordinate testing of new functionality and regression testing, Provide updates on the project status to senior management and stakeholders, Must be highly disciplined, a self-starter, and have the ability to execute on assignments independently. Adaptability to learn new tasks and demonstrate a willingness to understand the details of a process. Strong ownership with ability to operate in a flexible, dynamic environment where creative and strategic thinking are also required in driving solution, initiatives and projects Strong team player with good communication skills, ability to work in collaboration building strong rapport with peers Ability to multi-task and work well under pressure to meet deadlines Strong analytical, organizational and prioritization skills High level of integrity Strategic thinking with the ability to implement and manage day-to-day tasks, Identify critical requirements and potential gaps by understanding complex and interdependent processes

Excellent communication skills and ability to build strong partnership with stakeholders across business and technology teams.

Job Description : Job summary The Amazon Prime Video team is shaping the future of digital video entertainment. The Original Content group focuses on ensuring we invest in the most promising original content for our customers and invent and implement policies and procedures to protect the investment of Amazon in original content. We are seeking to fill a Production Finance executive to be a key leader for Amazon's South Asia Digital Video team to manage the original content production. This position involves many ad hoc projects, and therefore a successful candidate will have the ability to tackle multiple projects and efficiently execute deliverables. The right individual will have exceptional Finance skills and strong understanding of Finance & Accounting principles, solid leadership skills and firm business judgment capable of driving an organization to the right results. He or she will have operated successfully in a fast-paced, global, results-oriented environment, and have the ability to influence the decisions of senior business leaders through effective verbal and written communication, logical reasoning, and the presentation of alternatives. The successful candidate must be able to think and act both strategically and tactically. Strong oral and written communication skills are crucial, as well as ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, scope technical requirements and prioritize. The team needs a self-starter, who is able to work effectively autonomously and drive projects with the team and cross-functionally with other teams including Development, Production & Operations, Legal and Business Affairs, Finance and Accounting. The candidate will need to able to collaborate with business partners across the globe and must display strong initiative for anticipating and meeting the business demands of senior-level business managers. The ideal candidate will understand the television and original production business and be able to liaise between the Amazon business teams and local producers. Key job responsibilities . Serve as main point of contact between multiple original television productions and Amazon Studios finance team. . Review production budgets, cost reports, trial balances and petty cash reconciliations prepared by show accountants . Hire talented production accounting teams with the skill set to provide the highest level of production accounting support on shows that are both ambitious and complex . Work with show accountants on a day to day basis to drive accurate, complete and timely cost reporting, protecting and managing show assets and supporting production . Collaborate with Line Producers, Production Managers, Production Accounting Staff and the Amazon Production team to prepare all financial reports, ensure proper reconciliation of accounts, and ensure production's cash flow and payment needs are met . Work closely and collaboratively with Amazon Studios teams including Legal, Tax, Business Affairs, Production, Finance and Accounting . Manage production incentive workflow and ensure receipt of tax credits or cash. Manage cash flow and funding processes . Develop/improve financial reporting processes, controls, and policies . Create and drive innovative solutions that will enable the finance org to maintain effective controllership in a high growth business. Basic Qualifications : . Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Mathematics or a similar field . Minimally 5 years of experience in production finance/accounting and an analytical frame of mind . Knowledge of the entertainment and production business . Strong organization and time management skills . Must be very detail-oriented and meticulous in the follow through of documentation, processes and procedures . High aptitude and enthusiasm for complex strategic problem solving utilizing financial modeling and analysis, including great Excel skills . Strong capabilities for developing and presenting analyses and insights to senior management . Excellent written and oral communication Preferred Qualifications : . Proficiency in financial software and systems including Excel, Access, and COGNOS. Knowledge of SQL, database, and data mining is desirable. Knowledge of production accounting software is also a plus . Demonstrated ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously and drive projects to completion. . Ability to build and manage models for business forecasting, variance analysis, and problem solving . Experience supporting new business launch

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President - Private Bank/Wealth Management - AML Compliance Risk Management
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : The Compliance Anti Money Laundering Risk Management Senior Analyst is an intermediate level role responsible for recommending/establishing internal procedures to prevent money laundering and assist in all matters concerning financial crimes in coordination with the broader Anti-Money Laundering (AML) team. The overall objective is to utilize established disciplinary knowledge to identify inconsistencies in data or result and formulate strategic recommendations on policies, procedures, and practices. Wealth Management in APAC (incl CPB) is embarking on an ambitious expansion plan over the next 5 years and the candidate should hold the skill sets to navigate through this change project by supporting the business as well as adapt to the new expanded model in APAC. The primary objective of the Regional Citi Private Bank ACRM team is to pro-actively develop, monitor, and oversee realized and potential AML risks within the Wealth Management businesses, keep senior management apprised of the levels of new AML risk, and advise the business owners concerning methods and controls to manage that risk. Responsibilities: Identify, vet and address potential risks or escalated issues with the assistance of functional partners and key stakeholders Utilize information from regulatory changes, new regulations, and internal policy changes to further identify new key risk areas Analyze comparative data, prepare and present reports related to AML risk assessments, and monitor AML related issues and escalations Develop approaches/action plans to compliance and control issues by weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations Create and develop AML Compliance Risk Management (ACRM) standards and policies Advise and recommend a plan of action for management based on analysis of risk information Assist in coaching and training new recruits Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 5-8 years of experience Anti-Money Laundering (AML) certification Knowledge of Anti-Money Laundering (AML) requirements applicable to banks Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication Education: Bachelor's Degree/University degree or equivalent experience This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required. ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Compliance and Control ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: AML Compliance & Risk Mgmt ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job_Title: Startup Account Manager, Singapore, AWS Startups
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Job summary Would you like to be part of a team focused on building adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) within Startups in Singapore Do you have the business savvy and the technical acumen necessary to help establish Amazon Web Services as the premier cloud provider We are looking for a talented individual who would like to be part of an organization driving hyper-growth and helping startups operate on AWS and innovate on our platform. Do you have the business savvy to lead a cross-functional team that includes specialists, solution architects, and product and partner teams to deliver business growth for AWS and our startup customers AWS is seeking an experienced Account Manager for Strategic Startup Sales to lead and expand the business with our hottest Singapore Startups. The right candidate will possess a technology sales management background and experienced with engagements at the CXO level. He/she should also be able to effectively engage AWS most senior product leaders and executive team to define and deliver creative proposals and influence roadmap decisions for both AWS and our ISV partners. Lastly, you must be a self-starter who is prepared to own, define, develop and execute a geographic plan and to consistently deliver on quarterly wins targets. Key job responsibilities . Impact market share in the Startup vertical. . Exceed set business objectives. . Develop and execute against a comprehensive sales plan. . Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services. Accelerate customer adoption. . Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption. . Possess the technical ability to explain (not implement) Cloud Computing, infrastructure solutions (Server, Storage, DC Services) & Internet architectures (firewalls, load balancers, etc). . Develop case studies. . Draft various business reports. . Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts. . Ensure customer satisfaction. . Expect moderate travel. Basic Qualifications : . BA/BS degree required. . A technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus. . 10 years of experience in IT sales. Preferred Qualifications : . Direct sales experience with Singapore based customers. . Existing network in the Singapore Startup community is a plus. . People Management and Sales Management. . Would have consistently exceeded key performance metrics. . Demonstrated ability to engage and influence C-level executives. . Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences. . Strong technical competencies in the areas of cloud computing, SOA, web services and enterprise software. . Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations. What if I'm not an expert in all the above That's okay. We hire people who have a passion for learning, and are curious to build, learn and grow. You will be supported in your career development here at AWS. You will have plenty of opportunities to build your technical, leadership, business and consulting skills. This will include formal and on the job training, and a chance to learn and upskill through AWS certification courses and mentorship. You will learn from and collaborate with some of the brightest technical minds in the industry today. If you want to work with the best cloud technologies from the world's leading cloud provider, apply now. We can't wait to see what you build here. Come build the future with AWS. CULTURE AND COMMITMENT TO INCLUSION, DIVERSITY & EQUITY At AWS, we welcome all builders. We believe that technology should be built in a way that's inclusive, accessible, and equitable. We're committed to putting in the work for more equal representation Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Job_Title: Relationship Manager - Global Subsidiaries Group (RAM team, Singapore)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Citi's unparalleled global network is its biggest strength. The Global Subsidiaries Group (GSG) is that global network that delivers solutions to world leading corporations. In line with the trend of regionalization of the client buying center, Citi has pioneered coverage via the GSG Regional Account Manager( RAM) team. Being a sophisticated and large buying center, this demands best in class coverage. The RAM acts as the central client contact in the region and orchestrates the local delivery and execution of the Bank's broad spectrum of solutions. The support banker works with the RAM in managing the regional relationship( APAC + Japan). In addition, the support banker will directly cover local Singapore based subsidiaries of select RAM managed clients. Role is based in Singapore reporting to the Head of APACRAM Team Key Responsibilities: Role location: Singapore Responsible for ambitious and market leading revenue growth Deep understanding of client KPI's, and client wallet, and a clear SOW growth strategy. Risk: act as strong first line of defense Understanding of products across the complexity spectrum: such as commodities, structured trade/ lending, derivatives. Equally importantly, a track record of keenness to continuously learn. Important focus on Content Delivery by capitalizing on the work produced internally in Citi, industry expertise as well as by being fully acquainted of the external business, economic and operating environment in the relevant industry and within APAC. In the RAM Support Banker role, key responsibilities include assisting the RAMs in: Preparation of client pitch materials, regional review materials, Client Account Plans, senior briefing memos, etc. Co-coordinating various dialogues, exercises, projects with in-country SAMs Responding to clients queries or channeling the queries to the appropriate internal team for responding, ensuring turnaround time and quality responses are provided In the Singapore SAM role, key responsibilities include: Managing relationships with assigned clients Achieving agreed revenue targets Identifying new business opportunities with clients and originating new deals across products, working closely with product partners where possible Identifying clients needs i.e. product / credit / operational / resourcing and working through internal chains to deliver on those Understanding of Citi's KYC policies / requirements and on-time completions of CADDs Understanding of Citi's Risk policies / requirements and on-time completions of EUDDs Positive Voice of the Customer feedback Qualifications and Experience Required: Overall banking ( Coverage/ Product) experience of 5+years of which, at least 2 years of front-line experience. Demonstrate broad product expertise, in particular those with more complex characteristics: Capital Markets, Fixed Income and Derivatives, Export Agency Financing, and other Structured Financings Good understanding of the local / regional competitive environment Strong track record of demonstrating the highest degree of ownership, ie self-starters who are willing to OWN, LEAD and DRIVE the APAC client relationship Product versatility desired across Risk, Capital Markets and Flow products Experience in dealing with multiple geographies while working in coverage positions would be a plus Strong appreciation of cultural and matrix sensitivities is a must Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Institutional Banking ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Corporate Banking ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The Client Manager is the pivotal relationship in the Client Delivery team responsible for delivering exceptional client account management. The Client Manager is responsible for proactively managing the client account on all day to day maintenance activities to ensure the highest level of client service and relationship health. The Client Manager will support the Global Account Managers (GAMs)/Regional Account Managers (RAMs)/Field Account Managers (FAMs) on an aligned client portfolio to ensure strong client delivery execution. Business Partnership Provide direct support to the GAM/RAM/FAM through proactive client account management of the following activities: Ensure the highest level of client service and risk mitigation through proactive client account management support with client on-boarding (liaising with IMO), credit monitoring (liaising with CA COE) and flow maintenance Actively engage and collaborate with Clients, GAMs/RAMs/FAMs and Product Partners to understand and respond to any issues/concerns relating to the ongoing account maintenance including highlighting any unusual utilization patterns to coverage teams. Provide proactive support on account maintenance activities like documentation, reporting etc by engaging and collaborating with the client, IMO, CA, CRC, LDU, MDU, Legal and Compliance and relevant ops teams as required to ensure the clients expectations are met or exceeded Escalate issues/concerns relating to account maintenance activities to the CM Team Lead for follow up as relevant Documentation: Credit (existing deals Renewals/Amendments) & Other (Excluding credit approvals) Engagement and coordination with Legal & Compliance, Credit, CRC, CDU and Clients on standard documentation requirements such as standard terms, country supplements, banking facility letter, master credit terms, supplementary letters etc Obtain necessary approvals for T&C deviations on standard documentation from the relevant authoriser as necessary Follow through to ensure documentation completion and validate limits are correctly loaded/reflected in TP systems Ensure document deficiencies are minimised (as reflected in DDW etc) and are rectified in a timely manner Engage and follow up with IMO/GAM/RAM/FAM if required with respect to any outstanding CDD related items e.g Update known changes, respond to case queries, CDD overdues, approval/review of CDD cases, etc. Account Management & Portfolio Quality (Excluding credit approvals) Ensure general portfolio hygiene of client data from a quality control perspective i.e. correct client tagging, limit information, segment classification etc in SCI, WorkBench. Annotate on past dues and excesses daily in the portfolio. i.e. Ensure excesses/past dues are regularized on time and cash/cheques are released on time. Any exceptions to be highlighted to Banker and CA. Act as escalation points for Unsettled (FX) Past Due Trades reports & Failed trades reports, working closely with Operations where relevantSupport Loan Drawdown, Cash Management, LTP Trades (FI), Trade Offerings & Audit Confirmations Manage any client related data queries and remediation efforts, including first level escalations on account maintenance activities Seek transactional approvals as necessary (ie trade, cash) and release trade offerings on time to ensure faster TAT on trade transactions. Attend ASTAR Review meetings as appropriate and articipate in relevant business meetings, forums or committees as required Provide support on other projects as assigned Key Stakeholders Internal: GAM/RAM/FAM for designated portfolio Credit Analyst and Correspondent Banking Due Diligence (Banks)/Client Risk Manager (NBFI) for designated portfolio (as relevant) Product partners for designated portfolio Key functional partners ie COBAM, CET, Credit, CRC, CDU, LDU, MDU, Legal, Compliance, Product Ops (Trade, Cash, FMO etc), Finance, Marketing CM Team Lead Segment Leadership team External: Clients Legal firms, Audit Market Data Services providers Processes Ensure adherence to all internal/regulatory policies & regulations eg. Policies and procedures in RiskPod (FATCA, Credit, BCA overdue, etc) Identify and escalate any operational risks relating to the client portfolio account management and escalate to the CM Team Lead Co-ordinate with Ops/GSSC to rectify any ops related issues which can be resolved locally and issue Standard Instruction Forms (SIFs) wherever required within authority Risk Management Be proactive in ensuring compliance with Bank policies and procedures and lead preparation of client files for audit purposes Governance Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group&rsquos arrangements to deliver effective governance, oversight and controls in the business and, if necessary, oversee changes in these areas Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role. Responsible for delivering &lsquoeffective governance capability to challenge fellow executives effectively and willingness to work with any local regulators in an open and cooperative manner. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group&rsquos Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Help drive the business to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank&rsquos Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for ClientsFinancial Crime ComplianceThe Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Adhere to local regulator, MAS prescribed responsibilities and Rationale for allocation. Key Stakeholders Internal: GAM/RAM/FAM for designated portfolio Credit Analyst and Correspondent Banking Due Diligence (Banks)/Client Risk Manager (NBFI) for designated portfolio (as relevant) Product partners for designated portfolio Key functional partners ie COBAM, CET, Credit, CRC, CDU, LDU, MDU, Legal, Compliance, Product Ops (Trade, Cash, FMO etc), Finance, Marketing CM Team Lead Segment Leadership team External: Clients Legal firms, Audit Market Data Services providers Other Responsibilities Embed Here for good and Group&rsquos brand and values in CIB Singapore Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures. Our Ideal Candidate Bachelor degree in Banking or Finance preferred. Minimum 3+ years experience in banking or other relevant environment Risk & AML certified as stipulated by Bank policy for Client Manager role English and/or local language skills as relevant to country requirements Exceptional collaboration skills and ability to work effectively in a team Excellent communication skills verbal and written with ability to engage effectively with stakeholders at all levels both internal and external Strong ability to problem solve Demonstrated ability to work under pressure, operate with a sense of urgency and deliver to tight deadlines Well organised with strong ability to prioritise effectively Client focused mindset with demonstrated success in building strong client relationships and/or engaging and servicing clients effectively Preferably with : Strong understanding of client delivery processes and adherence to standards and controls Strong product knowledge including cross-product operational knowledge and/or experience Comprehensive understanding of all systems required to effectively manage the client account Knowledge of coverage policies core to the responsibilities of this role i.e. CDD, Credit and Bank legal documentation frameworks Strong understanding of Credit & AML Risk Comprehensive understanding the network and ability to facilitate network delivery through relevant documentation support Understanding of the client&rsquos account management needs and expectations Sound analytical skills to identify emerging risks, analyse transactional reports and identify issues Ability to meet the client&rsquos account maintenance needs and effectively support the GAM/FAM with all process, reporting and documentation management requirements including CDD and Credit support Role Specific Technical Competencies Manage Conduct Risk Management and Internal Controls (SIF) Business - Strategy and Business Model (SIF) Business - Market Knowledge (SIF) Business - Products and Processes Business - Business Partnering Business - Process Management Risk Management - C&I Credit Risk Sales - Relationship Management Information Systems - Applications & PC Skills Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. Job_Title: Senior Financial Analyst, Prime Video Southeast Asia
Job_Descriptions: Job Description : Job summary Amazon's Prime Video is a premium on-demand video entertainment service that offers customers original programming from around the world to over 240 countries. The Amazon Prime Video (PV) team is shaping the future of digital video entertainment. Our mission is to offer customers the widest selection of digital video content including Amazon Original content and make it trivially easy for them to enjoy it wherever and whenever they want. The Prime Video International Finance team is looking for an exceptional Senior Financial Analyst to support the Prime Video business in the South East Asia (SEA) region. The international expansion team is focused on combining our US Original programming alongside locally produced and licensed shows that accelerate Amazon's flywheel in nascent countries. This role will support the regional marketing leaders and their respective teams to manage marketing activities both through paid channels and on-site placements. In doing so, the individual will partner with business teams to analyze and approve marketing proposals, identify and implement processes and KPIs to evaluate effectiveness of marketing campaigns, and own controllership. This role will also manage monthly close/reporting and all budgeting/planning activities for marketing spend. This opportunity is ideal for a finance professional who is passionate about video entertainment and looking for a challenge in a high growth, new business environment. The right individual will have experience working cross-functionally and the ability to influence business leaders through effective verbal and written communication, logical reasoning, and the presentation of alternatives. Basic Qualifications : . BA/BS Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering or similar discipline with analytical bias and a minimum of 5 years of finance experience . Advanced analytical skills and expertise with building financial models and processes using MS Excel Preferred Qualifications : . MBA or Master's degree in Finance or quantitative field . Prior work experience in an entertainment company or supporting marketing teams . Advanced analytical skills and expertise with building financial models and processes using MS Excel . Ability to meet tight deadlines, prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, dynamic, ever-growing and often ambiguous environment . Comfortable working in cross-functional teams . Excellent written and oral communication with proven influencing skills

Job_Title: Senior Operational Risk Officer, CRO Functions
Job_Descriptions: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The purpose of the Senior Operational Risk Officer (SORO) role is to support the Chief Risk Officer (CRO) Functions (COO, Technology & Innovation) by developing and maintaining deep knowledge of the COO Function and its risk landscape and to act as the single point of contact (&lsquoSPOC) within the Second-Line in respect of all Operational Risk matters, collaborating as appropriate with Centres of Expertise (&lsquoCOEs). The COO & GBS Functions include - Cyber Security Services (CSS), Operational Resilience comprising of Business Continuity Management (BCM), Operational Continuity in Resolution (OCIR) and Crisis Management (CM), Data Management and Privacy, Analytics and Automation, GBS Global Business Services, Financial Crime Surveillance Office (FCSO) and Enablement & Transformation (E&T) office. This role includes accountability for monitoring and ensuring that the COO Functions meet their obligations under the various Principal Risk Types (PRT) frameworks (especially the Operational & Technology Risk Type Framework (&lsquoO&T RTF)) and that breaches / weaknesses are appropriately identified and escalated. Focus will be applied in defined COO areas but does not negate providing support across all COO pillars when required. This accountability is discharged in part through collaboration with other Second-Line Operational Risk teams and COEs, as well as enterprise-wide SMEs. Strategy Inform the development of business plans with the provision of operational loss forecasts and a balanced judgement on operational risks. Provide strategic guidance to the COO Function on risk implications of strategies and plans. This includes recommendations to change strategies and plans to order to fit within Risk Appetite. Collaborate with ERM, Risk Type COEs and others and guide the COO Function to influence - and thereafter support adherence to / engagement with risk-related frameworks, policies, standards, process and initiatives. The SORO supports the CRO accountabilities which envelop all Second Line responsibilities within Risk Type Frameworks for Principal Risk Types, feeding into their development and maintenance as relevant, all as defined within the Group&rsquos Enterprise Risk Management Framework. This includes oversight, review and challenge of all risk decision making within the assigned COO and GBS Function. The role holder has a responsibility for ensuring full adherence by the COO Function with the O&T RTF in particular, as this brings together Second-Line responsibilities across several PRTs, alongside other sub-Risk Types (as defined therein). An understanding of the interplay between the O&T RTF and all Risk Type Frameworks as a requirement for this role. Operational Risk spans an array of potential for financial loss and negative impact on our clients and providers of capital. A developed understanding of this potential and the business case for minimising loss and impact is a requirement for this role. From a regulatory perspective, under Section 320 of the European Union Capital Requirements Regulation (CRR) banks are required to demonstrate the ability to identify their exposures to Operational Risk and have in place an appropriate system of monitoring and control, Understanding this and other relevant regulatory requirements and guidance in respect of Operational Risk is a requirement for this role. While the majority of Operational Risk management is done in the First-Line, the Group&rsquos Operational Risk team (whether embedded in Country CRO functions, or housed at a Group-level, collectively &lsquoGORT) is accountable for monitoring and ensuring that Operational Risk is appropriately identified, assessed, understood/calibrated, controlled and managed, with Risk Appetite clearly articulated and supported by appropriate stress testing. GORT is also responsible for ensuring appropriate escalation, follow-up and learning from Operational Risk Events / Incidents. The role-holder is expected to take the lead in delivering on these GORT accountabilities for the COO Function. Working in partnership with Country and Regional Second-Line Operational Risk experts, those charged with Operational Risk management in the First-Line and identified SMEs enterprise wide the team is charged with ensuring the adequacy of and adherence to - a comprehensive Operational Risk Type Framework. The role-holder is required to understand the role and responsibilities of the GORT as a whole and how these are discharged by the team, actively contributing to development and improvement in the same, as well as to remain informed of pertinent industry and organisational developments. Business Implement the strategic intent and agenda for the Operational Risk function as defined by the Group. Maintain and develop operational risk capabilities, skills, and infrastructure to meet ongoing needs and plans for the functions. Demonstrate deep understanding of the local, regional, global and COO Function strategic priorities to effectively advise and challenge decisions across all relevant Risk Types Review and recommend resolutions to Risk related escalations from the business / functions keeping in mind Risk Appetite thresholds, policies and procedures Work with business to clarify / interpret any policy related matters or queries Identify internal / external insights and emerging risks that can impact the [Business / Function] Attend relevant [Business/Function] Risk committees representing Risk in advising, challenging and providing Risk insights to business / functions stakeholders The role-holder is also responsible for taking a lead in ensuring that the COO Function adheres to agreed [Operational] Risk Appetite, including supporting the COO Function in defining its [Operational] Risk strategy in conjunction with Group Internal Audit and Compliance. This includes the challenging of the COO Function strategy and Corporate Plan and seeking to embed awareness and engagement with all [PRTs and] Operational Risk sub-types across the COO Function. This will be achieved through partnership, challenge and control as follows: Partnership: Offering general advice on all [PRTs and] Operational Risk sub-types to key stakeholders. Challenge: Reviewing and challenging the COO Function&rsquos articulation and calibration of [Operational] Risk identification of risks and potential points of failure, control design and implementation and continual review of both gross and residual risk assessments. Control: Drive and foster adoption of and monitor adherence to - the Operational Risk Type Framework - and related Policy and Standards - by the COO Function, including adherence to clearly defined roles for each of the three lines of defence, supported by appropriately designed training and other awareness/engagement-focused routines. Responsibilities discharged through pooled resource focused on Testing and Thematic Reviews include the following: Monitoring: Collate, aggregate and analyse Operational Risk data (RCSA data, incident data) to assess trends and broader effectiveness in Operational Risk management and to draw out insights and recommendations Identification: Partner with CRO and Single Point of Contact SOROs and other stakeholders to identify key topics for thematic review (leaning on monitoring work) and build annual book-of-work plan Review: Undertake deep dive reviews of operational risk management effectiveness focused around themes that necessarily cut across individual sub-Risk Types, geographies or product areas. Enhancement: Ensure lessons and findings are socialised and recommendations implemented. Processes Take ownership for all Second-Line accountabilities within the Operational Risk Type Framework, as they pertain to the COO Function, seeking to deliver the same effectively and efficiently. Fully adhere to and actively contribute to - all agreed governance (e.g. committees) and other routines (regular meetings, attendance at other forums) for the GORT teams or, where applicable and requested, the COO Function. Act as an advocate for the GORT teams, its objectives and best practice in Operational Risk management more broadly where opportunity arises. Adhere to such other process and governance requirements as requested by line management, from time to time. People and Talent Team Management: Uphold and reinforce the independence of the GORT teams, including through setting and monitoring appropriate Job Descriptions for direct reports and rigorous adoption of other people management routines (objective setting, performance reviews, development and training reviews etc.) Talent Management: Help the GORT teams to identify, attract, employ, engage and retain high performing and high potential individuals as needed for the team and more broadly, including ensuring a high-quality succession pipeline. Leadership: Lead through example and tone and help to build the appropriate culture and values within the team and across the wider organisation, communicating vision and building commitment and energy to focus on key priorities Risk Management Ensure all activity adheres to the Risk Management Framework, with a specific focus on ensuring an effective framework for the management of Operational Risks within the team as they pertain to the role. Challenge the completeness of risk identification, monitoring, and control activities across Operational Risk Control Areas within COO Functions and identify and address any significant gaps that may exist between them. Job Description : Job summary At Amazon, our vision is to be Earth's most customer-centric company. Our passion for invention leads us to pioneer and globalize new businesses and customer offerings daily. As we rapidly become the world's largest consumer of corporate services in many categories, the Corporate Procurement team is fueling our explosive growth by identifying innovative sourcing strategies and negotiating sustainable, long-term partnerships. Amazon is seeking a Global Category Manager (GCM) to join the Corporate Procurement team. The role could be based in Singapore or Sydney (Australia). GCMs serve in a pivotal role, leading strategic sourcing engagements across a wide range of business units to enable new business initiatives to launch and scale rapidly. Spend categories under management include Marketing, Professional Services, HR, Travel, Temp Labor, Architecture, Construction, and Facilities. Key leadership traits required include the ability to influence and form strong partnerships with business leaders, and operational excellence in managing multiple complex and competing priorities simultaneously. Global Category Managers are expert practitioners in the tools for creating competitive environments, and have a strong bias for decision-making rooted in data and analytics. They routinely influence C-level vendor relationships by advising senior Amazon leaders across multiple stakeholder groups on the direction of sourcing projects in support of business unit and corporate goals. If you are looking for a new challenge in a fast-paced, innovative company, come make history with Amazon's Corporate Procurement department. Successful candidates must work well in a fast-paced and often ambiguous arena, and will be rewarded by working alongside highly collaborative and entrepreneurial colleagues in an environment that feels much more startup than big company. Primary responsibilities of this role: . Establishing strong relationships with internal business stakeholders building a strong understanding of strategic business direction, requirements and priorities across assigned suppliers and/or spend categories. . Developing global sourcing strategies to deliver against business objectives for internal clients. . Evaluating supplier core competencies and competitive positioning using industry cost models and bench-marking analysis. . Managing the fundamentals of sourcing and supplier engagement activities including RFx, spend pattern analysis, contract analysis, bid evaluation, negotiations, and supplier consolidation. . Identifying sourcing opportunities by leveraging spend analysis tools and engage with stakeholders to consolidate requirements over categories, suppliers and geographies. . Work with business and finance leaders to identify and drive savings and controllership improvements, focusing on total cost of ownership. . Providing guidance to internal stakeholders on procurement strategies maintaining procurement ethics in accordance with Amazon's global policies. . Prepare and hold business reviews with stakeholders to review vendor performance, future opportunities, and/or challenges. Basic Qualifications : Basic Qualifications . 7+ years of relevant strategic sourcing experience, to include at minimum, 4 years in an indirect procurement function at a multinational corporation with global contracts. . In-depth experience in best-in-class procurement practices (category management, bench-marking, should-cost models, RFX, reverse auction, contracting, etc.). . BS/BA Degree. Preferred Qualifications : Preferred Qualifications . Master's Degree (MBA/MS) . Strong negotiator with proven experience in setting negotiation strategies and conducting negotiations. . Extensive knowledge of the basic types of commercial agreement structures and the function and purpose of key legal terms. . Strong experience assessing risk and concisely explaining complex issues to principal business owners. . Extremely customer-focused and takes the time to understand the needs of the business. . Experience working in a large, global, highly matrixed organization. . Strong analytical skills including the ability to quickly synthe, distill and draw conclusions on large amounts of disparate data. . Ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects requiring frequent communication, organization, time management, and problem-solving skills. . Excellent written and oral communication skills. . Passionate self-starter with the highest integrity and ethics.

The Role Responsibilities Role Purpose The role of the Global Resourcing Relationship Manager, CPBB (RRM) is to create and own Resourcing strategy and delivery for the CPBB Business. They will need to work in close partnership with Global Heads of Businesses, Global & Regional Management Teams (GMTs/RMTs), Country Management Teams (CMTs), Global and Regional Heads of HR, HRBPs and other COEs to understand demand and ensure appropriate strategy to fulfil the requirements. The RRM is a global role and will manage other Relationship Managers (RMs) supporting CPBB. The RRM will be a part of the Global Resourcing Leadership team. The role will require knowledge of the latest industry trends, industry leading practices, and insights gained from the design and implementation of large scale talent management, talent acquisition, leadership, onboarding and culture programmes for similar organisations. The role holder will be articulate and thoughtful about directing and challenging the work produced and will back it up by evidence based thinking. Detailed Responsibilities: Oversee all Resourcing activity across CPBB globally and represent Resourcing at Business Management Team meetings. Design a comprehensive plan for Resourcing across CPBB globally, reflecting the Bank&rsquos strategic direction in key markets, products and new developments. Lead the gathering and sharing with Resourcing colleagues of any geographically-relevant market intelligence which will enable the better identification of talent. Engagement with key stakeholders to scope, design and deploy solutions that align with the overall Resourcing strategy, processes, policies and governance requirements, seeking required dispensations as required. Assessment of new requests to deploy differentiated recruitment models from business or HR stakeholders. Commercial agreement with business stakeholders on the funding of all specialist models and ensuring recharges are completed in a timely manner each month. Performance oversight of all hiring in CPBB globally. Strategy In partnership HR and business stakeholders, define the Resourcing needs of the business and put plans into place to manage these which are aligned to the global Resourcing Strategy. Define and agree reasonable but stretch service standards with stakeholders to measure the effectiveness of Resourcing services. Generate a robust plan of hiring demand and ensure that resource requirements are in place to deliver these or activity prioritised in agreement with stakeholders. Build strong partnerships with Senior hiring, NEW and Early Careers teams to ensure they have all the required information/data to deliver hiring they manage, ensuring all hiring is delivered in line with business expectations. Build partnerships and work closely with end to end CoE teams in relation to compliance standards and delivery of end to end resourcing e.g. Staff Screening, On-boarding. Conduct and share external market analysis to obtain relevant market intelligence which will enable the better identification of Talent and keep the Resourcing model refreshed. Proactively identify areas where dispensations may be required and work with relevant CoE members to agree these or manage business expectations accordingly. Member of the Global Resourcing Leadership team driving consistency and continuous improvement across Resourcing globally. Keep a focus on alignment to the overall Operating Model, setting the foundations to pivot towards this if differentiate Resourcing models are in place. Provide direction and quality assurance to the prioritisation, scoping, design, and delivery activities for programmes within the Resourcing relating to CPBB Business Enable business strategies and objectives through Talent and Resourcing solutions Manage conflicts in stakeholder expectations, cost constraints, employee experience and HR good practice in solution design Understand risks, business imperatives and business context when facilitating decision making impacted by the target operating model, creating solution options, and making recommendations Sets direction and presents clear options and recommendations, facilitate decision making and enable clear understanding in key stakeholders of risks, outcomes and trade-offs Where delivery is required via country/regional resourcing teams, ensure stakeholders are briefed on the differentiated model and also ensure local Resourcing teams are adequately briefed to deliver against the demand. Provide resourcing performance analysis and drive continuous improvement in Specialist services using data and reporting to offer insights to relevant stakeholders. Demonstrate deep understanding of business environment and strategy in order to effectively articulate challenges and opportunities. Act as an escalation point for delivery failures and partner with thebusiness and respective Resourcing teams to implement rapid resolution plans. Keep abreast of external practices and maintains own external network brings the outside into the Group and understands how to apply external practices into the Group successfully. Processes Implement robust tracking, and reporting framework for the end-to end resourcing process including MI, Dashboards, metrics, KPI reporting and analysis, for monthly business reviews and other strategic purposes. I n depth knowledge of Resourcing processes and understand regulatory / compliance requirements interpreting into necessary actions and incorporating in processes to ensure ongoing compliance. Partner with CoE team if Resourcing activity requires updates of changes to HRPU. Review all relevant Process Operating Instructions (POIs) as required. Work in partnership with the business to remove any obstacles to delivery. Close analysis of available metrics to understand service delivery challenges work collaboratively to resolve these through drawing together all relevant stakeholders. Develop and implement solutions which meet functional and business strategic and operational requirements and improve HR organisational effectiveness People and Talent Ensure all teams are staffed to full capacity as agreed with stakeholders and in line with parameters agreed. Effectively manage any gaps in resource related to planned/unplanned leave, exits etc. Mentor and coach direct reports, ensuring there is an embedded culture of appropriate reward and development. Ensure direct reports have the appropriate skills and tools to be able to provide an effective partnership to their stakeholders. Set appropriate tone and expectations with team and work in collaboration with partners. Set and monitor job descriptions and objectives for direct reports and provide feedback and reward in line with performance against responsibilities and objectives. Create and maintain a culture of open communication at all levels which subsequently filters through to excellent customer engagement Empower team members to work across organisational and functional boundaries to drive ongoing improvement in existing Resourcing products, and identify opportunities for operational improvements in product delivery. Role model valued behaviours, leading by example. Risk Management & Governance Work with CoE teams to ensure all end to end Resourcing processes across CPBB are followed in line with policy to mitigate any risk exposure. Accountable for resourcing-related risks in CPBB. Understanding of operational risks in areas of responsibility. Proactive risk management remain vigilant in identifying and managing forward-looking risks, flagging potential problems to relevant stakeholders in advance of issues arising. Act to minimise operational loss and audit failures and take proactive measures to respond to issues once they have arisen. Drive a culture of continuous improvement, learning from past failures to ensure constant control and governance awareness and prevent reoccurrences. Ensuring all reporting and metrics are delivered to pre-agreed standards. Embed the Group&rsquos Valued Behaviours and Code of Conduct across the team. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group&rsquos Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Management Teams within CPBB Global/Regional/Country Heads of HR HRBPs Global Head of Resourcing & Talent Deployment Resourcing Relationship Managers Resourcing Quality Assurance Leads Heads of Resourcing/NEW teams Resourcing CoE Teams Head of Employer Branding & Attraction Head of Specialist Resourcing Other Responsibilities Expertise as the face of Resourcing to senior stakeholders within CPBB. Demonstrated relationship and stakeholder management skills across diverse groups of people. Have an extensive background in Resourcing across functional and business areas for senior hiring. Exceptional ability to communicate and collaborate across business and functional areas and geography. Demonstrate exceptional and unrelenting ethical behaviour on a daily basis. Be a subject matter expert when it comes to all aspects of Resourcing inclusive of process management and candidate management. Strong business acumen and the ability to create Specialist solutions in line with budget parameters set by businesses funding. Title: Head, Global and Strategic Partners Why will you enjoy this new opportunity We are looking for an experienced Partner Manager to be leading our Global and Strategic Partners team chartered with establishing and scaling Customer Success through our partner ecosystem. This is a key role that is responsible for accelerating the partnership with global partners in terms of joint solution offerings and driving profitable growth with our global partners community within Southeast and Korea (SEAK), reporting to the Director, Partner Business for SEAK. The ideal candidate has partner success experience, an exceptional track record in building and growing channel partner relationships, and a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges. In addition, the candidate should also possess the following experience: Prior experience working with leadership at channel partners to launch and successfully execute new programs What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing Responsible for leading our team of Partner Business Managers and Partner Development Managers for developing business with Global System Integrators and OEMs within that territory. As the Head of Global and Strategic Partners, your main goal is to achieve revenue targets through your partner ecosystem where applicable. Also based on your deep understanding of VMware channel program, you should leverage to increase partner engagement and profitability. Driving partner-led customer success with Global and Strategic Partners as part of RTM strategy and plans of record. Acceleration of partners adoption of VMware solutions, capability, and capacity through partners. Meet and exceed Key Performance Indicators and metrics for Global and Strategic Partners. Establish partnership/advisory relationships with Partner Executive leaders, program sponsors and key stakeholders. Leading and facilitating collaborative engagements with your business partners to support greater revenue streams. Help bring a strategy focus and best practices to support sustainable growth. Influencing and aligning resources to support your business to achieve greater outcomes and meeting your sales target. The Work: What type of work will you be doing What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis Be the front-line manager, building, developing, and managing a partner business team, taking responsibility for driving new business and developing the territory. Design and implement competitive strategies based on past practice and knowledge of effective sales methodologies whilst creating and implementing a sales strategy aligning with regional and overall SEAK business direction to meet set sales targets within given deadlines. Regular two-way communication and review with your team regarding their partner account strategies, forecasts, methodologies and support them through joint engagements. Establish and position VMware as a thought leader in these areas and drive team collaboration with internal resources such as technical, marketing, and professional services to support partner and customer needs, sales strategy, and overall business growth. Influence strategy, engagement, channel, and customer interactions at a manager level across the business. Coach and drive sales methodologies including VMware sales tools and process as amended from time to time, to communicate, report, track, forecast and manage sales opportunities within the team. Coach and develop the team on continual improvement to achieve and exceed quotas and bookings. UnderstandVMware partner programs and able to educate internal and external stake holders . Driving joint business plan with partner executives, execute the mutually agreed business plans with all levels within partner organisations. Increase partner sales, delivery capacity, and development, around key focused pipeline motions including volume-based inside selling and value-based field selling of advanced technologies within the strategic priorities of Multi-Cloud, Virtual Cloud Network, App Modernization, Intrinsic Security and Digital Workspace. Align field and specialist reps with partners, and utilize strategic motions, such as assessments, development funds, and ad-hoc programs, to accelerate pipeline. Create a co-selling practice, by developing joint account plans between the customer, the partner, and the VMware core sales team. Match partners to large accounts and connect core and partner salespeople on large deals to increase sales velocity and customer value. Businessacumen:Sales and business insight, in recognizing and acting on go-to-market plans, marketing programs, joint value propositions, and business cases around strategic partnerships. Driveforresults:Highly motivated, driven, andstrong andgood business ethics required of you. Proven track record of achieving business objectives in a highly competitive partner channel environment, including meeting or exceeding revenue goals and working with complex national and global partners and system integrators. What is the leadership like for this role What is the structure and culture of the team like The role would be reporting into our Director of Partners Business, SEAK who leads a team of Partner Business Managers and Partner Development Managers across Southeast Asia and Korea. It is a dynamic and united team, and we work cohesively together to achieve results as One VMware to help our business partners in accelerating their digital transformation journey. Are you considering to be part of a talented and dynamic team to transform this digital world and partner business using leading edge technologies If so, we would love to hear from you! Where is the role located Singapore. Non-remote. VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what's possible today at http://careers.vmware.com. Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Job Description : Data Engineer Responsible for both small business and consumer marketing business data analysis and data processing. Participate into developing the promising campaign application and help rollout globally. Design and implement data warehouse model and ETL on Dell Greenplum platform, building Power BI Dashboard that provides data insight to all the business user to optimize business performance. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Data Engineering Adv on our Marketing team in Beijing . What you'll achieve Interfaced with Consumer Marketing team, provide data and analytical service to stakeholders, helping to build a full data capability to better tailor business, make better decisions and understand more about what customers need. You will: Work with customers to define business requirements while designing, developing and testing moderately complex knowledge capture processes and engineer elaborate dataflows, search capabilities and measurement approaches Analyze and interpret data requests from the Business. Deliver regular and ad-hoc data/analytics service to be handed over to Business partners Collaborate with stakeholders and business users to identify Data collection and CDI enhancements and actively participate in the management of any related projects Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents and provide timely and meaningful feedback Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test cases Work with local technical team, global technical team, supplier team for joint data architecture design, interface build up and validation. Consult and utilize various software packages and tools for data transforming, processing, analyzing for business Essential Requirements Bachelor or Master's degree in computer science, electronic technology or related majors Proficient in SQL programing, having a deep understanding of SQL and SQL tuning Proficient in Python, know how to use pandas, gevent, greenlet, flask or Django Deep understanding in data warehouse design, data model build-up, ETL flow define and enhance. Ability to interpret data and develop recommendations based on findings Fluent in English, both spoken and written Desirable Requirements 3 - 5 years Data consultant experience in retail, marketing or related fields Experience in analyzing Marketing vehicle or campaign performance, optimizing customer strong communication skills including marketing-oriented acumen, written and verbal presentations Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and meet project timelines Strong advisory and consulting experience Demonstrated stakeholder management and relationship skills Here's our story now tell us yours Dell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We're proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What's most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life -- while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn't stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what's next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 Closing date: 30/06/2022 Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. About DPDHL Group and Corporate Internal Audit: Deutsche Post DHL (DPDHL) Group the logistics provider of the world with over 520,000 employees in more than 220 countries and territories. Improving Lives.” Corporate Internal Audit of Deutsche Post DHL Group performs worldwide audits across all business units and supporting functions, e.g. Finance, IT, Compliance of the group. We provide independent and objective auditing services and audit related consulting services with regard to compliance requirements for the Board and Senior Management. Become a member of our international team in Singapore and support us with your expertise, your creativity and your flexibility. We are currently recruiting to fill the following vacancies based in Singapore. Specific Role and Challenges: Participate in audit teams (typical 2-3-person teams); Ability to present audit issues and recommendations to senior management; Planning and conducting process-oriented topics such as financial, commercial, operational, Human Resources and business management system audits within the Asia-Pacific region; Strong communication skills (i.e. able to provide both verbal and written information in a timely, clear and concise manner and expresses ideas effectively, adjusting style, tools and mode to the needs of the organization, able to explain technical issues to non-specialists Excellent verbal communication, with ability to explain technical issues to non-specialists Personable, and able to work effectively within a team Strong analytical and conceptual skills High degree of personal responsibility Very good communication and negotiation skills Respect and Interest in other cultures and high degree of integrity Willingness to travel up to 65% of the time (or more if business needs dictate) Preferred Big Four auditing/consulting experience and/or DHL Logistics business experience Hands-on experience of financial accounting and reporting Knowledge of IFRS Accounting Standards Knowledge of internal audit standards (CIA certification) Knowledge of Data Analytics for audit purpose (e.g. ACL, PowerBI etc.) Your profile should looks like: Minimum 3 years of audit experience in the Big Four public accounting firms or internal audit experience in multinational companies; Experience in operational auditing will be an added advantage; Bachelor degree in Accounting or Qualified accounting certification such as CA, ACCA, CIMA, CPA. CIA (Certified Internal Auditor) qualification will be a plus The successful candidate can expect a competitive remuneration package and rewarding career in fast-paced and challenging environment. Respond promptly to system issues and incidents on 24x7 basis. Provides specialist infrastructure support to project teams to enable them to onboard to Cloud. What we are looking for At least 4 years’ experience in the managing enterprise systems on Commercial Cloud platforms, systems integration, systems operations, network and/ or cyber security Relevant expertise in virtualisation and container technologies, service based architectures, software defined networking and virtualised communications infrastructure components Relevant expertise in the architecting of cloud security best practices using one or more of the Cloud Service Providers Good working knowledge in one or more of the following Cloud Automation tools Scripting for provisioning Management of Cloud Operations Key systems management components Security vulnerability assessments, security risk assessments, local and site recovery assessments, processes and mitigation measures.
